Package propra.model

Class ReachabilityGraph

java.lang.Object
propra.model.ReachabilityGraph
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ReachabilityGraph extends Object implements Serializable
This class provides the functionality to build a Reachability Graph for a Petrinet. It can furthermore check if a graph is bounded, and if so, retrieve the Path of a partial reachability graph as well as m and m'.
See Also:

      to - The destination vertex of the arc.

    • getCount

      public String getCount()
      Provides a formatted string representing the counts of vertices and arcs in the graph.
      Returns:
      A string in the format "vertices / arcs".

    • isBounded

      public Boolean isBounded()
      Determines if the graph is bounded.
      Returns:
      true if the graph is bounded, false otherwise.

    • shortestPath

      public List<Vertex> shortestPath(Vertex source, Vertex destination)
      Finds the shortest path between two vertices using Dijkstra's algorithm. This method calculates the shortest path in a graph from the source vertex to the destination vertex. It uses a breadth-first search approach and keeps track of predecessors to reconstruct the path once the destination is reached.
      Parameters:
      source - The starting vertex of the path.
      destination - The destination vertex of the path.
      Returns:
      A list of vertices representing the shortest path from source to destination. Returns an empty list if no path is found.

    • getPath

      public String getPath()
      Generates a string representation of the path traversed from the initial vertex to m'.
      Returns:
      A string representing the path.
